name: Bylgja
description:
Bylgja
Nine Daughters of Ægir and Rán

Norse Mythology[]
Bylgja meaning "Billow" In Norse mythology, the goddess Rán and the Jötunn Ægir both personify the sea, and together they have nine daughters who personify waves. Each daughter's name reflects poetic terms for waves. The sisters are attested in the Poetic Edda, compiled in the 13th century from earlier traditional sources; the Prose Edda, composed in the 13th century; and in the poetry of skalds. Scholars have theorized that these daughters may be the same figures as the nine mothers of the god Heimdallr. In Norse Mythology Heimdall is the child of the Nine Daughters of Ægir and Rán and the God Odin.
In the God of War Series[]
Bylgja is one of the daughters of Ægir and Rán. Bylgja has eight known sisters, Blóðughadda, Drǫfn, Dúfa, Hefring, Himinglæva, Hrǫnn, Kólga and Unnr. The daughters were referenced in the Lake of Nine. It is also currently unconfirmed if Heimdall's father is Odin like he is in Norse Mythology.
Trivia[]
In mythology, Bylgja, along with all their sisters gave birth to Heimdall at once.
